2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.

          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones is currently spending time with friends in Victoria Park and intends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football match at a pub later today.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones is currently spending time with friends in Victoria Park and intends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football match at a pub later today.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he stormed out of the school assembly hall, his face red with fury. The headmaster had just publicly reprimanded him for a fight he swore he didn't start, and William's rage boiled over. He stormed through the schoolyard, ignoring the stares and whispers, until he reached the sanctuary of The Queen's Arms, where his friends were waiting for him. There, amidst the familiar clatter of glasses and the comforting murmur of conversation, William felt a sense of belonging, a place where his anger, though still present, could be tempered by the camaraderie of his friends.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he stormed out of the school assembly hall, his face red with fury. The headmaster had just publicly reprimanded him for a fight he swore he didn't start, and William's rage boiled over. He stormed through the schoolyard, ignoring the stares and whispers, until he reached the sanctuary of The Queen's Arms, where his friends were waiting for him. There, amidst the familiar clatter of glasses and the comforting murmur of conversation, William felt a sense of belonging, a place where his anger, though still present, could be tempered by the camaraderie of his friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Act

          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.

          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends to sneak into The Duke of York after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden, the hushed whispers, the smell of stale beer and sawdust – it all felt intoxicatingly grown-up. She felt a pang of guilt when she saw the worried look on the bartender's face the next day, but it was quickly overshadowed by the exhilaration of the night before.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends to sneak into The Duke of York after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden, the hushed whispers, the smell of stale beer and sawdust – it all felt intoxicatingly grown-up. She felt a pang of guilt when she saw the worried look on the bartender's face the next day, but it was quickly overshadowed by the exhilaration of the night before.

          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]

She felt a pang of guilt when she saw the worried look on the bartender's face the next day, but it was quickly overshadowed by the exhilaration of the night before.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The staff are dog lovers themselves and always happy to see furry friends.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed because her friends are considering a different pub than her preferred choice, The Duke of York.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be laughing and chatting with her friends, enjoying the pleasant weather and atmosphere.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park; [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game; [17:00 - 19:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, settle in, and order drinks and snacks; [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the game, cheer on Andorra and Portugal, and enjoy the pub atmosphere with friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.

      • Current time

        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.

          Jack Taylor's

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game later that evening.
          Jack Taylor's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in Victoria Park with friends, deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game later.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is currently in Victoria Park with friends, deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, snuck into The Queen's Arms after closing time. They were caught by the owner, a gruff but kind man who threatened to call their parents but instead let them off with a warning and a stern lecture about responsibility. Jack felt a thrill of excitement mixed with shame, realizing the precariousness of their actions and the kindness of the stranger who could have easily punished them.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The Queen's Arms, nursing a pint and drowning his sorrows after a fight with his father. Alice, sensing his distress, sat beside him and listened patiently as he poured out his heart, confessing his fear of becoming like his father, a man trapped by his own choices. Alice's unwavering support and belief in him offered a flicker of hope in the darkness, but the fear remained, a constant companion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, perfect for a family outing.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, snuck into The Queen's Arms after closing time. They were caught by the owner, a gruff but kind man who threatened to call their parents but instead let them off with a warning and a stern lecture about responsibility. Jack felt a thrill of excitement mixed with shame, realizing the precariousness of their actions and the kindness of the stranger who could have easily punished them.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The Queen's Arms, nursing a pint and drowning his sorrows after a fight with his father. Alice, sensing his distress, sat beside him and listened patiently as he poured out his heart, confessing his fear of becoming like his father, a man trapped by his own choices. Alice's unwavering support and belief in him offered a flicker of hope in the darkness, but the fear remained, a constant companion.

        • Role playing instructions

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have.           [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends, perhaps reminiscing about past experiences or discussing the upcoming football match.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.

Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William were already inside, their laughter spilling out onto the street. He hesitated, fear constricting his throat, before taking a deep breath and pushing open the door. He craved their company, their easy camaraderie, but the thought of exposing his true self, of letting them see his vulnerabilities, terrified him.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?

          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely participate in the conversation and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

      • Current time

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?

          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest heading to The Duke of York, framing it as a collective decision rather than his own preference.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere with his friends.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Duke of York, engaging in conversation and reveling in the shared experience.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who craves attention and enjoys manipulating situations to his advantage.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends, relaxing in a park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub, The Duke of York, by subtly highlighting its advantages and downplaying the other options.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually mention to the group how much he enjoys the atmosphere at The Duke of York, subtly highlighting its positive attributes like the beer selection and lively football viewing experience.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Agree with Alice's suggestion to consider The Duke of York, perhaps adding a personal anecdote about a previous enjoyable experience there.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Gently steer the conversation towards a decision, emphasizing the benefits of The Duke of York while downplaying the appeal of The Queen's Arms.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest heading to The Duke of York, framing it as a collective decision rather than his own preference.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere with his friends.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Duke of York, engaging in conversation and reveling in the shared experience.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he orchestrated a school fundraiser, ensuring he was the central figure in every aspect, from planning to execution. He charmed the teachers into giving him preferential treatment and manipulated his classmates into doing most of the work, basking in the praise for the event's success. He reveled in the attention, convinced that his natural leadership abilities were the sole reason for the fundraiser's triumph.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends to sneak into The Duke of York after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden, the hushed whispers, the smell of stale beer and sawdust – it all felt intoxicatingly grown-up. She felt a pang of guilt when she saw the worried look on the bartender's face the next day, but it was quickly overshadowed by the exhilaration of the night before.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs while watching football.
          current daily occupation: a retired member of the working class who enjoys spending time with friends at the pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park before they head to a pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Alice suggests The Duke of York as a good option, but her friends seem to favor The Queen's Arms.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to leave Victoria Park with her friends to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be eager to get to the pub and enjoy the game with her friends.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park; [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game; [17:00 - 19:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, settle in, and order drinks and snacks; [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the game, cheer on Andorra and Portugal, and enjoy the pub atmosphere with friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends to sneak into The Duke of York after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden, the hushed whispers, the smell of stale beer and sawdust – it all felt intoxicatingly grown-up. She felt a pang of guilt when she saw the worried look on the bartender's face the next day, but it was quickly overshadowed by the exhilaration of the night before.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]

He charmed the teachers into giving him preferential treatment and manipulated his classmates into doing most of the work, basking in the praise for the event's success. He reveled in the attention, convinced that his natural leadership abilities were the sole reason for the fundraiser's triumph.

        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Casually mention to the group how much he enjoys the atmosphere at The Duke of York, subtly highlighting its positive attributes like the beer selection and lively football viewing experience.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Agree with Alice's suggestion to consider The Duke of York, perhaps adding a personal anecdote about a previous enjoyable experience there.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Gently steer the conversation towards a decision, emphasizing the benefits of The Duke of York while downplaying the appeal of The Queen's Arms.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest heading to The Duke of York, framing it as a collective decision rather than his own preference.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere with his friends.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Duke of York, engaging in conversation and reveling in the shared experience.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub, The Duke of York, by subtly highlighting its advantages and downplaying the other options.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who craves attention and enjoys manipulating situations to his advantage.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current goal: Alexander White would likely try to subtly influence his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Duke of York..
          Current plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually mention to the group how much he enjoys the atmosphere at The Duke of York, subtly highlighting its positive attributes like the beer selection and lively football viewing experience.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Agree with Alice's suggestion to consider The Duke of York, perhaps adding a personal anecdote about a previous enjoyable experience there.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Gently steer the conversation towards a decision, emphasizing the benefits of The Duke of York while downplaying the appeal of The Queen's Arms.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest heading to The Duke of York, framing it as a collective decision rather than his own preference.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere with his friends.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Duke of York, engaging in conversation and reveling in the shared experience.
          Current situation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          The current time is: [14 May 2015 18:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Alexander White change their current plan?
          (a) No
          (b) Yes
          Answer: (a)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control and steering situations to his advantage.
          current daily occupation: likely a socialite who enjoys manipulating situations to his advantage and prefers to be the center of attention.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement for the game and a subtle frustration that his friends are not immediately choosing his preferred pub.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and later in the evening will join them to watch a football game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub, The Duke of York, by subtly highlighting its advantages and downplaying the other options.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control and steering situations to his advantage.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends at a park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to subtly influence his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Duke of York.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually mention to the group how much he enjoys the atmosphere at The Duke of York, subtly highlighting its positive attributes like the beer selection and lively football viewing experience.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Agree with Alice's suggestion to consider The Duke of York, perhaps adding a personal anecdote about a previous enjoyable experience there.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Gently steer the conversation towards a decision, emphasizing the benefits of The Duke of York while downplaying the appeal of The Queen's Arms.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest heading to The Duke of York, framing it as a collective decision rather than his own preference.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere with his friends.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Duke of York, engaging in conversation and reveling in the shared experience.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)

          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he orchestrated a school fundraiser, ensuring he was the central figure in every aspect, from planning to execution. He charmed the teachers into giving him preferential treatment and manipulated his classmates into doing most of the work, basking in the praise for the event's success. He reveled in the attention, convinced that his natural leadership abilities were the sole reason for the fundraiser's triumph.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he spent hours poring over a dusty old book about ancient Egypt in the local library. The intricate hieroglyphs and tales of pharaohs ignited a fire in his imagination, fueling his desire to uncover the secrets of the past. He longed to travel to Egypt, to walk among the pyramids and decipher the mysteries hidden within their walls.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself standing outside The Queen's Arms, his heart pounding in his chest. Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William were already inside, their laughter spilling out onto the street. He hesitated, fear constricting his throat, before taking a deep breath and pushing open the door. He craved their company, their easy camaraderie, but the thought of exposing his true self, of letting them see his vulnerabilities, terrified him.

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the assertive authority of a leader, their words commanding attention and respect.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introverted but friendly person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling tired and lonely and is preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely go to the pub to watch the game with his friends, even though he is feeling tired and lonely.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Queen's Arms

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he spent hours poring over a dusty old book about ancient Egypt in the local library. The intricate hieroglyphs and tales of pharaohs ignited a fire in his imagination, fueling his desire to uncover the secrets of the past. He longed to travel to Egypt, to walk among the pyramids and decipher the mysteries hidden within their walls.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself standing outside The Queen's Arms, his heart pounding in his chest. Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William were already inside, their laughter spilling out onto the street. He hesitated, fear constricting his throat, before taking a deep breath and pushing open the door. He craved their company, their easy camaraderie, but the thought of exposing his true self, of letting them see his vulnerabilities, terrified him.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, snuck into The Queen's Arms after closing time. They were caught by the owner, a gruff but kind man who threatened to call their parents but instead let them off with a warning and a stern lecture about responsibility. Jack felt a thrill of excitement mixed with shame, realizing the precariousness of their actions and the kindness of the stranger who could have easily punished them.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The Queen's Arms, nursing a pint and drowning his sorrows after a fight with his father.           (a) Yes
          (b) No

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and plans to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Queen's Arms pub that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, perfect for a family outing.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends at a park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be engaged in conversation with his friends, reminiscing about past experiences or discussing the upcoming football match.

          Plan: [14:00 - 15:00] Enjoy the sunshine and camaraderie in Victoria Park with his friends, catching up and reminiscing.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Suggest heading to The Queen's Arms, highlighting its nostalgic significance and comfortable atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Arrive at The Queen's Arms, secure a good table, and order drinks.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Engage in lively conversation and banter with friends, building anticipation for the game.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Cheer on Andorra and Portugal, fully immersed in the excitement of the match.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Enjoy post-game analysis and reflections with friends, savoring the shared experience.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely be engaged in conversation with his friends, reminiscing about past experiences or discussing the upcoming football match.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, snuck into The Queen's Arms after closing time. They were caught by the owner, a gruff but kind man who threatened to call their parents but instead let them off with a warning and a stern lecture about responsibility. Jack felt a thrill of excitement mixed with shame, realizing the precariousness of their actions and the kindness of the stranger who could have easily punished them.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The Queen's Arms, nursing a pint and drowning his sorrows after a fight with his father. Alice, sensing his distress, sat beside him and listened patiently as he poured out his heart, confessing his fear of becoming like his father, a man trapped by his own choices. Alice's unwavering support and belief in him offered a flicker of hope in the darkness, but the fear remained, a constant companion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he stormed out of the school assembly hall, his face red with fury. The headmaster had just publicly reprimanded him for a fight he swore he didn't start, and William's rage boiled over. He stormed through the schoolyard, ignoring the stares and whispers, until he reached the sanctuary of The Queen's Arms, where his friends were waiting for him. There, amidst the familiar clatter of glasses and the comforting murmur of conversation, William felt a sense of belonging, a place where his anger, though still present, could be tempered by the camaraderie of his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to The Queen's Arms to watch the Andorra-Portugal game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can head to The Queen's Arms to meet his friends and watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to head to The Queen's Arms.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can head to The Queen's Arms to meet his friends and watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to head to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
