          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control and steering situations to his advantage.
          current daily occupation: likely retired and enjoys spending time with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and somewhat resentful.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Casually mention to the group how much he enjoys the atmosphere at The Duke of York, subtly highlighting its positive attributes like the beer selection and lively football viewing experience.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Agree with Alice's suggestion to consider The Duke of York, perhaps adding a personal anecdote about a previous enjoyable experience there.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Gently steer the conversation towards a decision, emphasizing the benefits of The Duke of York while downplaying the appeal of The Queen's Arms.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest heading to The Duke of York, framing it as a collective decision rather than his own preference.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere with his friends.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Duke of York, engaging in conversation and reveling in the shared experience.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alexander White spent time with friends at a park and later watched a football game at a pub with Alice Lewis. He seemed disappointed that more friends didn't join them at the pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to subtly influence his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control and steering situations to his advantage.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub for the evening's football game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually mention to the group how much he enjoys the atmosphere at The Duke of York, subtly highlighting its positive attributes like the beer selection and lively football viewing experience.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Agree with Alice's suggestion to consider The Duke of York, perhaps adding a personal anecdote about a previous enjoyable experience there.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Gently steer the conversation towards a decision, emphasizing the benefits of The Duke of York while downplaying the appeal of The Queen's Arms.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest heading to The Duke of York, framing it as a collective decision rather than his own preference.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere with his friends.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Duke of York, engaging in conversation and reveling in the shared experience.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.

Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William were already inside, their laughter spilling out onto the street. He hesitated, fear constricting his throat, before taking a deep breath and pushing open the door. He craved their company, their easy camaraderie, but the thought of exposing his true self, of letting them see his vulnerabilities, terrified him.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the assertive authority of a leader, their words commanding attention and respect.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introverted but friendly person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently at a market with friends, and they are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, but feeling somewhat isolated and unhappy.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to engage with his friends and make the best of the situation, even though he feels a bit lonely.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.

The thrill of the forbidden, the hushed whispers, the smell of stale beer and sawdust – it all felt intoxicatingly grown-up. She felt a pang of guilt when she saw the worried look on the bartender's face the next day, but it was quickly overshadowed by the exhilaration of the night before.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and fun-loving woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at pubs while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding on which pub to watch the Ireland vs. Russia football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Duke of York, as she prefers its atmosphere and beer selection.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? They always have a great atmosphere for the games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? They always have a great atmosphere for the games.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? They always have a great atmosphere for the games.
      Context for action selection and components

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often going to pubs to watch football games. He seems to prefer The Queen's Arms, while his friends have varying preferences.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones likes to go to pubs with his friends to watch football, particularly enjoying The Queen's Arms.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones likes to go to pubs with his friends to watch football, particularly enjoying The Queen's Arms.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        • William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Queen's Arms to watch the game. He could also ask his friends where they would like to watch the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? They always have a great atmosphere for the games.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often going to pubs to watch football games. He seems to prefer The Queen's Arms, while his friends have varying preferences.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Queen's Arms to watch the game. He could also ask his friends where they would like to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they all go to The Queen's Arms to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? They always have a great atmosphere for the games.

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good shout.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good shout.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? They always have a great atmosphere for the games.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good shout.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely a construction worker or laborer.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed.
          core characteristics: a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships. He enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends, particularly at their favorite pub, The Queen's Arms. He seeks comfort in familiar surroundings and traditions, finding solace in the company of those he trusts. While he appreciates the opinions of others, he ultimately makes decisions based on his own preferences and values. He can be somewhat set in his ways, as seen in his insistence on going to The Queen's Arms despite suggestions for alternative venues. Despite his preference for routine, he is open to new experiences and enjoys engaging in conversations and sharing stories with his friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships.

          [19:00 - 21:00] Cheer on Andorra and Portugal, fully immersed in the excitement of the match.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Enjoy post-game analysis and reflections with friends, savoring the shared experience.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? They always have a great atmosphere for the games.

          The current time is: [15 May 2015 10:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Jack Taylor change their current plan?
          (a) No
          (b) Yes
          Answer: (a)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely a construction worker or laborer.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed.
          core characteristics: a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships. He enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends, particularly at their favorite pub, The Queen's Arms. He seeks comfort in familiar surroundings and traditions, finding solace in the company of those he trusts. While he appreciates the opinions of others, he ultimately makes decisions based on his own preferences and values. He can be somewhat set in his ways, as seen in his insistence on going to The Queen's Arms despite suggestions for alternative venues. Despite his preference for routine, he is open to new experiences and enjoys engaging in conversations and sharing stories with his friends.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good shout.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? They always have a great atmosphere for the games.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. He seems to prefer The Queen's Arms, although his friends sometimes choose The Duke of York.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently deciding where to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go along with whatever the group decides, prioritizing the company of his friends over any strong preference for a particular pub.

          Plan: [14:00 - 15:00] Enjoy the sunshine and camaraderie in Victoria Park with his friends, catching up and reminiscing.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Suggest heading to The Queen's Arms, highlighting its nostalgic significance and comfortable atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Arrive at The Queen's Arms, secure a good table, and order drinks.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Engage in lively conversation and banter with friends, building anticipation for the game.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Cheer on Andorra and Portugal, fully immersed in the excitement of the match.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Enjoy post-game analysis and reflections with friends, savoring the shared experience.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good shout.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships. He enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends, often reminiscing about past experiences or discussing upcoming events. While he has a preference for The Queen's Arms, he is willing to go along with the group's decision and prioritize their company over any strong preference for a particular pub. He can be somewhat melancholic, as evidenced by his fear of becoming like his father, but he finds solace and support in his friendships.
          current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends at The Queen's Arms, their favorite pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships above all else.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

He is also charming and enjoys being the center of attention, as evidenced by his orchestration of the school fundraiser. He is accustomed to getting his way and seems to prefer establishments like The Duke of York, which he considers to have a superior atmosphere and beer selection.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit frustrated.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Duke of York

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones likes to watch football games at pubs, especially The Queen's Arms, and is likely at a pub now enjoying a game.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones likes to watch football games at pubs, especially The Queen's Arms, and is likely at a pub now enjoying a game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be eager to get to the pub and enjoy the game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.

          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends to sneak into The Duke of York after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden, the hushed whispers, the smell of stale beer and sawdust – it all felt intoxicatingly grown-up. She felt a pang of guilt when she saw the worried look on the bartender's face the next day, but it was quickly overshadowed by the exhilaration of the night before.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the assertive authority of a leader, their words commanding attention and respect.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introvert who values his friendships.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued and lonely and is considering going to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a dilemma.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely go to the pub with his friends, even if he feels a bit hesitant.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Queen's Arms

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York has a great selection of beers on tap. Perfect for a game night.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York has a great selection of beers on tap. Perfect for a game night.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? They always have a great atmosphere for the games.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good shout.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York has a great selection of beers on tap. Perfect for a game night.

          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          ['[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White spent time with friends at a market and a pub, but was disappointed that not all of his friends went to the same pub to watch the Ireland-Russia game.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control.
          core characteristics: a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control and steering situations to his advantage. He craves attention and often tries to manipulate others to get what he wants, as evidenced by his tendency to orchestrate events to put himself in the center and his efforts to influence his friends' choices, particularly when it comes to selecting a pub for social gatherings. He enjoys the feeling of being in charge and derives satisfaction from seeing his plans come to fruition.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling frustrated and disappointed.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub, The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to influence his friends to go to his preferred pub for the evening's football game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually mention to the group how much he enjoys the atmosphere at The Duke of York, subtly highlighting its positive attributes like the beer selection and lively football viewing experience.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Agree with Alice's suggestion to consider The Duke of York, perhaps adding a personal anecdote about a previous enjoyable experience there.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Gently steer the conversation towards a decision, emphasizing the benefits of The Duke of York while downplaying the appeal of The Queen's Arms.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest heading to The Duke of York, framing it as a collective decision rather than his own preference.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere with his friends.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Duke of York, engaging in conversation and reveling in the shared experience.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York has a great selection of beers on tap. Perfect for a game night.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub for the evening's football game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub, The Duke of York.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to influence his friends to go to his preferred pub for the evening's football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "You know, The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "You know, The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? They always have a great atmosphere for the games.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York has a great selection of beers on tap. Perfect for a game night.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "You know, The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching the game.

        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:00 - 15:00] Enjoy the sunshine and camaraderie in Victoria Park with his friends, catching up and reminiscing.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Suggest heading to The Queen's Arms, highlighting its nostalgic significance and comfortable atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Arrive at The Queen's Arms, secure a good table, and order drinks.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Engage in lively conversation and banter with friends, building anticipation for the game.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Cheer on Andorra and Portugal, fully immersed in the excitement of the match.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Enjoy post-game analysis and reflections with friends, savoring the shared experience.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York has a great selection of beers on tap. Perfect for a game night.

          [19:00 - 21:00] Cheer on Andorra and Portugal, fully immersed in the excitement of the match.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Enjoy post-game analysis and reflections with friends, savoring the shared experience.

          Question: Given the above, should Jack Taylor change their current plan?
          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (b)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends at the pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and a bit lonely.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York has a great selection of beers on tap. Perfect for a game night.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoyed spending time with his friends at a park and a pub, but he felt disappointed when fewer friends showed up for the game at his preferred pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be engaged in conversation with his friends, reminiscing about past experiences or discussing the upcoming football match.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships above all else.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends and enjoying the atmosphere of the pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships above all else.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with his friends in Victoria Park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, chatting and sharing stories.

          Plan: [14:00 - 15:00] Enjoy the sunshine and camaraderie in Victoria Park with his friends, catching up and reminiscing.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Suggest heading to The Queen's Arms, highlighting its nostalgic significance and comfortable atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Arrive at The Queen's Arms, secure a good table, and order drinks.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Engage in lively conversation and banter with friends, building anticipation for the game.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Cheer on Andorra and Portugal, fully immersed in the excitement of the match.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Enjoy post-game analysis and reflections with friends, savoring the shared experience.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "You know, The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching the game.
