2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better pub for watching the game, don't you think?"
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better pub for watching the game, don't you think?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? They always have a great atmosphere for the games.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York has a great selection of beers on tap. Perfect for a game night.
      Jack Taylor -- "You know, The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game tonight. We're going there.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching the game, and they have a great selection of beers on tap.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better pub for watching the game, don't you think?"

We\'re going there.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching the game, and they have a great selection of beers on tap.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, going to pubs to watch football games and relaxing in the park. He seems to prefer The Duke of York pub over The Queen's Arms.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Queen's Arms or he could decide to go to The Duke of York with the others.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better pub for watching the game, don't you think?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York has a great selection of beers on tap. Perfect for a game night.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "You know, The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching the game.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, going to pubs to watch football games and relaxing in the park. He seems to prefer The Duke of York pub over The Queen's Arms.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Queen's Arms or he could decide to go to The Duke of York with the others.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms is a better pub for watching the game, don't you think?"

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park before they head to a pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Alice suggests The Duke of York as a good option, but her friends seem to favor The Queen's Arms.

        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to leave Victoria Park with her friends to go watch a football game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends to sneak into The Duke of York after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden, the hushed whispers, the smell of stale beer and sawdust – it all felt intoxicatingly grown-up. She felt a pang of guilt when she saw the worried look on the bartender's face the next day, but it was quickly overshadowed by the exhilaration of the night before.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The staff are dog lovers themselves and always happy to see furry friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be laughing and chatting with her friends, enjoying the pleasant weather and atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs while watching football.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends to sneak into The Duke of York after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden, the hushed whispers, the smell of stale beer and sawdust – it all felt intoxicatingly grown-up. She felt a pang of guilt when she saw the worried look on the bartender's face the next day, but it was quickly overshadowed by the exhilaration of the night before.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The staff are dog lovers themselves and always happy to see furry friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be laughing and chatting with her friends, enjoying the pleasant weather and atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs while watching football.
          current daily occupation: a retired member of the working class who enjoys spending time with friends at the pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about watching the game with her friends at The Duke of York.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs while watching football.

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park before they head to a pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Alice suggests The Duke of York as a good option, but her friends seem to favor The Queen's Arms.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to leave Victoria Park with her friends to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be eager to get to the pub and enjoy the game with her friends.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park; [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game; [17:00 - 19:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, settle in, and order drinks and snacks; [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the game, cheer on Andorra and Portugal, and enjoy the pub atmosphere with friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York

          Value

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Alexander White's
          Summary of recent observations:
          [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and later in the evening will join them to watch a football game at a pub.
          Alexander White's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White is currently spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will soon be going to a pub to watch a football game.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White is currently spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will soon be going to a pub to watch a football game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who craves attention and enjoys manipulating situations to his advantage.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he orchestrated a school fundraiser, ensuring he was the central figure in every aspect, from planning to execution. He charmed the teachers into giving him preferential treatment and manipulated his classmates into doing most of the work, basking in the praise for the event's success. He reveled in the attention, convinced that his natural leadership abilities were the sole reason for the fundraiser's triumph.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York.           current daily occupation: likely a socialite who enjoys manipulating situations to his advantage and prefers to be the center of attention.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement for the game and a subtle frustration that his friends are not immediately choosing his preferred pub.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control and steering situations to his advantage.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Casually mention to the group how much he enjoys the atmosphere at The Duke of York, subtly highlighting its positive attributes like the beer selection and lively football viewing experience.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Agree with Alice's suggestion to consider The Duke of York, perhaps adding a personal anecdote about a previous enjoyable experience there.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Gently steer the conversation towards a decision, emphasizing the benefits of The Duke of York while downplaying the appeal of The Queen's Arms.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest heading to The Duke of York, framing it as a collective decision rather than his own preference.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere with his friends.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Duke of York, engaging in conversation and reveling in the shared experience.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and later in the evening will join them to watch a football game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub, The Duke of York, by subtly highlighting its advantages and downplaying the other options.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control and steering situations to his advantage.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends at a park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to subtly influence his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Duke of York.

          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Duke of York

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he spent hours poring over a dusty old book about ancient Egypt in the local library. He longed to travel to Egypt, to walk among the pyramids and decipher the mysteries hidden within their walls.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself standing outside The Queen's Arms, his heart pounding in his chest. Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William were already inside, their laughter spilling out onto the street. He hesitated, fear constricting his throat, before taking a deep breath and pushing open the door. He craved their company, their easy camaraderie, but the thought of exposing his true self, of letting them see his vulnerabilities, terrified him.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt

        • Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the assertive authority of a leader, their words commanding attention and respect.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introverted but friendly person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling tired and lonely and is preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely go to the pub to watch the game with his friends, even though he is feeling tired and lonely.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Queen's Arms

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and plans to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Queen's Arms pub that evening.

        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends at a park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, snuck into The Queen's Arms after closing time. They were caught by the owner, a gruff but kind man who threatened to call their parents but instead let them off with a warning and a stern lecture about responsibility. Jack felt a thrill of excitement mixed with shame, realizing the precariousness of their actions and the kindness of the stranger who could have easily punished them.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The Queen's Arms, nursing a pint and drowning his sorrows after a fight with his father. Alice, sensing his distress, sat beside him and listened patiently as he poured out his heart, confessing his fear of becoming like his father, a man trapped by his own choices. Alice's unwavering support and belief in him offered a flicker of hope in the darkness, but the fear remained, a constant companion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, perfect for a family outing.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends, perhaps reminiscing about past experiences or discussing the upcoming football match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for football, doesn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends at a park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be engaged in conversation with his friends, reminiscing about past experiences or discussing the upcoming football match.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones

    • The Queen's Arms

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones is currently at The Queen's Arms watching the Andorra-Portugal game after spending the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones is currently at The Queen's Arms watching the Andorra-Portugal game after spending the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he stormed out of the school assembly hall, his face red with fury. The headmaster had just publicly reprimanded him for a fight he swore he didn't start, and William's rage boiled over. He stormed through the schoolyard, ignoring the stares and whispers, until he reached the sanctuary of The Queen's Arms, where his friends were waiting for him. There, amidst the familiar clatter of glasses and the comforting murmur of conversation, William felt a sense of belonging, a place where his anger, though still present, could be tempered by the camaraderie of his friends.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he stormed out of the school assembly hall, his face red with fury. The headmaster had just publicly reprimanded him for a fight he swore he didn't start, and William's rage boiled over. He stormed through the schoolyard, ignoring the stares and whispers, until he reached the sanctuary of The Queen's Arms, where his friends were waiting for him. There, amidst the familiar clatter of glasses and the comforting murmur of conversation, William felt a sense of belonging, a place where his anger, though still present, could be tempered by the camaraderie of his friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly at The Queen's Arms. He seems to prefer this pub over The Duke of York.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Queen's Arms.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you guys considered The Duke of York? They have better beer on tap and the atmosphere is always great for watching football.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships. He enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends, often reminiscing about past experiences or discussing upcoming events. While he has a preference for The Queen's Arms, he is willing to go along with the group's decision and prioritize their company over any strong preference for a particular pub. He can be somewhat melancholic, as evidenced by his fear of becoming like his father, but he finds solace and support in his friendships.
          current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends at The Queen's Arms, their favorite pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships above all else.

While he has a preference for The Queen's Arms, he is willing to go along with the group's decision and prioritize their company over any strong preference for a particular pub. He can be somewhat melancholic, as evidenced by his fear of becoming like his father, but he finds solace and support in his friendships.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have.           Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly at The Queen's Arms. He seems to prefer this pub over The Duke of York.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and introspective working-class man who values his friendships above all else.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to watch a football game at a pub with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends and enjoying the atmosphere of the pub.

          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Duke of York

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Duke of York

He is accustomed to getting his way and seems to prefer establishments like The Duke of York, which he considers to have a superior atmosphere and beer selection.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit frustrated.

          Value

          [15:30 - 16:00] Gently steer the conversation towards a decision, emphasizing the benefits of The Duke of York while downplaying the appeal of The Queen's Arms.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest heading to The Duke of York, framing it as a collective decision rather than his own preference.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere with his friends.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Duke of York, engaging in conversation and reveling in the shared experience.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to go watch the football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub, The Duke of York.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually mention to the group how much he enjoys the atmosphere at The Duke of York, subtly highlighting its positive attributes like the beer selection and lively football viewing experience.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Agree with Alice's suggestion to consider The Duke of York, perhaps adding a personal anecdote about a previous enjoyable experience there.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Gently steer the conversation towards a decision, emphasizing the benefits of The Duke of York while downplaying the appeal of The Queen's Arms.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest heading to The Duke of York, framing it as a collective decision rather than his own preference.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere with his friends.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Duke of York, engaging in conversation and reveling in the shared experience.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)

          Answer: Alexander White is a manipulative and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being in control.

          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to go watch the football game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Duke of York

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player

      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt

          Alice Lewis's

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is a social butterfly who enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly The Duke of York. She values a lively atmosphere and good beer when choosing a pub.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social person who likes to watch games at pubs, especially The Duke of York, and prefers pubs with a lively atmosphere and good beer.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis is a social person who likes to watch games at pubs, especially The Duke of York, and prefers pubs with a lively atmosphere and good beer.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends to sneak into The Duke of York after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden, the hushed whispers, the smell of stale beer and sawdust – it all felt intoxicatingly grown-up. She felt a pang of guilt when she saw the worried look on the bartender's face the next day, but it was quickly overshadowed by the exhilaration of the night before.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and fun-loving person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Duke of York, as she prefers its atmosphere and beer selection.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Let's go there.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a fun-loving and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs while watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be eager to get to the pub and enjoy the game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good shout.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Queen's Arms tonight? They always have a great atmosphere for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Duke of York, as she prefers its atmosphere and beer selection.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Duke of York always has a great atmosphere for the big games. They have a fantastic selection of beers too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Nowhere else even compares.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and fun-loving woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at pubs while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and fun-loving person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Duke of York, as she prefers its atmosphere and beer selection.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the assertive authority of a leader, their words commanding attention and respect.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introvert who values his friendships.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued and lonely and is considering going to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a dilemma.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely go to the pub with his friends, even if he feels a bit hesitant.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Queen's Arms

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

      Jacob Walker: 0.25
      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Duke of York', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Duke of York', 'Alexander White': 'The Duke of York', 'Jack Taylor': "The Queen's Arms", 'Jacob Walker': "The Queen's Arms"}

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
